00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_unsigned.h -- Arbitrary precision unsigned arithmetic.
00023 
00024     This file includes the definitions of sc_unsigned_bitref,
00025     sc_unsigned_subref, and sc_unsigned classes. The first two classes
00026     are proxy classes to reference one bit and a range of bits of a
00027     sc_unsigned number, respectively.
00028 
00029     An sc_signed number has the sign-magnitude representation
00030     internally. However, its interface guarantees a 2's-complement
00031     representation. The sign-magnitude representation is chosen
00032     because of its efficiency: The sc_signed and sc_unsigned types are
00033     optimized for arithmetic rather than bitwise operations. For
00034     arithmetic operations, the sign-magnitude representation performs
00035     better.
00036 
00037     It is also important to note that an sc_unsigned number with n
00038     bits is equivalent to an sc_signed non-negative number with n + 1
00039     bits.
00040 
00041     The implementations of sc_signed and sc_unsigned classes are
00042     almost identical: Most of the member and friend functions are
00043     defined in sc_nbcommon.cpp and sc_nbfriends.cpp so that they can
00044     be shared by both of these classes. These functions are chosed by
00045     defining a few macros before including them such as IF_SC_SIGNED
00046     and CLASS_TYPE. Our implementation choices are mostly dictated by
00047     performance considerations in that we tried to provide the most
00048     efficient sc_signed and sc_unsigned types without compromising
00049     their interface.
00050 
00051     For the behavior of operators, we have two semantics: the old and
00052     new. The most important difference between these two semantics is
00053     that the old semantics is closer to C/C++ semantics in that the
00054     result type of a binary operator on unsigned and signed arguments
00055     is unsigned; the new semantics, on the other hand, requires the
00056     result type be signed. The new semantics is required by the VSIA
00057     C/C++ data types standard. We have implemented the new semantics.
00058 
00059   Original Author: Ali Dasdan, Synopsys, Inc.
00060 
00061  *****************************************************************************/
00062 
00063 /*****************************************************************************
00064 
00065   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00066   changes you are making here.
00067 
00068       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00069   Description of Modification:
00070 
00071  *****************************************************************************/

00474   // LOGICAL OPERATORS:

00629 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00630 //  CLASS : sc_unsigned_bitref_r
00631 //
00632 //  Proxy class for sc_unsigned bit selection (r-value only).
00633 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00634 
00635 class SC_API sc_unsigned_bitref_r : public sc_value_base
00636 {
00637     friend class sc_unsigned;
00638 
00639 protected:
00640 
00641     // construction and initialization:
00642 
00643     sc_unsigned_bitref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_index(0), m_obj_p(0)
00644         {}
00645 
00646     void initialize( const sc_unsigned* obj_p, int index_ )
00647         {
00648             m_obj_p = const_cast<sc_unsigned*>( obj_p );
00649             m_index = index_;
00650         }
00651 
00652 public:
00653 
00654     // destructor
00655 
00656     virtual ~sc_unsigned_bitref_r()
00657         {}
00658 
00659     // copy constructor
00660 
00661     sc_unsigned_bitref_r( const sc_unsigned_bitref_r& a )
00662         : sc_value_base(a), m_index( a.m_index ), m_obj_p( a.m_obj_p )
00663         {}
00664 
00665     // capacity
00666 
00667     int length() const
00668         { return 1; }
00669 
00670 
00671     // implicit conversion to bool
00672 
00673     operator uint64 () const;
00674     bool operator ! () const;
00675     bool operator ~ () const;
00676 
00677 
00678     // explicit conversions
00679 
00680     uint64 value() const
00681         { return operator uint64(); }
00682 
00683     bool to_bool() const
00684         { return operator uint64(); }
00685 
00686 
00687     // concatenation support
00688 
00689     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00690         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return 1; }
00691     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00692         { return (uint64)operator uint64(); }
00693     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00694         {
00695             int  bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00696             int  word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00697             dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00698             return false;
00699         }
00700     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00701         {
00702             int  bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00703             bool result;        // True if non-zero.
00704             int  word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00705             if ( operator uint64() )
00706             {
00707                 dst_p[word_i] |= bit_mask;
00708                 result = true;
00709             }
00710             else
00711             {
00712                 dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00713                 result = false;
00714             }
00715             return result;
00716         }
00717 
00718     // other methods
00719 
00720     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00721         { os << to_bool(); }
00722 
00723 protected:
00724 
00725     int          m_index;
00726     sc_unsigned* m_obj_p;
00727 
00728 private:
00729 
00730     // disabled
00731     const sc_unsigned_bitref_r& operator = ( const sc_unsigned_bitref_r& );
00732 };
00733 
00734 
00735 
00736 inline
00737 ::std::ostream&
00738 operator << ( ::std::ostream&, const sc_unsigned_bitref_r& );
00739

00754 protected: // construction
00755

00757         {}
00758 
00759 public:
00760 
00761     // copy constructor

00764         : sc_unsigned_bitref_r( a )
00765         {}
00766 
00767 
00768     // assignment operators
00769 
00770     const sc_unsigned_bitref& operator = ( const sc_unsigned_bitref_r& );
00771     const sc_unsigned_bitref& operator = ( const sc_unsigned_bitref& );
00772     const sc_unsigned_bitref& operator = ( bool );
00773 
00774     const sc_unsigned_bitref& operator &= ( bool );
00775     const sc_unsigned_bitref& operator |= ( bool );
00776     const sc_unsigned_bitref& operator ^= ( bool );
00777

00781     virtual void concat_set(const sc_signed& src, int low_i);
00782     virtual void concat_set(const sc_unsigned& src, int low_i);
00783     virtual void concat_set(uint64 src, int low_i);
00784 
00785 
00786     // other methods

00801 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00802 //  CLASS : sc_unsigned_subref_r
00803 //
00804 //  Proxy class for sc_unsigned part selection (r-value only).
00805 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00806 
00807 class SC_API sc_unsigned_subref_r : public sc_value_base
00808 {
00809     friend class sc_signed;
00810     friend class sc_unsigned;
00811     friend class sc_unsigned_signal;
00812 
00813 protected:
00814 
00815     // constructor
00816 
00817     sc_unsigned_subref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_left(0), m_obj_p(0), m_right(0)
00818         {}
00819 
00820     void initialize( const sc_unsigned* obj_p, int left_, int right_ )
00821         {
00822             m_obj_p = const_cast<sc_unsigned*>( obj_p );
00823             m_left = left_;
00824             m_right = right_;
00825         }
00826 
00827 public:
00828 
00829     // destructor
00830 
00831     virtual ~sc_unsigned_subref_r()
00832         {}
00833 
00834 
00835     // copy constructor
00836 
00837     sc_unsigned_subref_r( const sc_unsigned_subref_r& a )
00838         : sc_value_base(a), m_left( a.m_left ), m_obj_p( a.m_obj_p ),
00839           m_right( a.m_right )
00840         {}
00841 
00842 
00843     // capacity
00844 
00845     int length() const
00846         { return m_left >= m_right ? (m_left-m_right+1) : (m_right-m_left+1 ); }
00847 
00848 
00849     // implicit conversion to sc_unsigned
00850 
00851     operator sc_unsigned () const;
00852 
00853 
00854     // explicit conversions
00855 
00856     int           to_int() const;
00857     unsigned int  to_uint() const;
00858     long          to_long() const;
00859     unsigned long to_ulong() const;
00860     int64         to_int64() const;
00861     uint64        to_uint64() const;
00862     double        to_double() const;
00863 
00864 
00865     // explicit conversion to character string
00866 
00867     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const;
00868     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const;
00869 
00870 
00871     // concatenation support
00872 
00873     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00874         {
00875             if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false;
00876             return m_left - m_right + 1;
00877         }
00878     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const;
00879     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00880     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00881 
00882     // reduce methods
00883 
00884     bool and_reduce() const;
00885     bool nand_reduce() const;
00886     bool or_reduce() const;
00887     bool nor_reduce() const;
00888     bool xor_reduce() const ;
00889     bool xnor_reduce() const;
00890 
00891     // other methods
00892 
00893     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00894         { os << to_string(sc_io_base(os,SC_DEC),sc_io_show_base(os)); }
00895 
00896 protected:
00897 
00898     int          m_left;   // Left-most bit in this part selection.
00899     sc_unsigned* m_obj_p;  // Target of this part selection.
00900     int          m_right;  // Right-most bit in this part selection.
00901 
00902 private:
00903 
00904     // disabled
00905     const sc_unsigned_subref_r& operator = ( const sc_unsigned_subref_r& );
00906 };
00907 
00908 
00909 
00910 inline
00911 ::std::ostream&
00912 operator << ( ::std::ostream&, const sc_unsigned_subref_r& );
00913

00991 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00992 //  CLASS : sc_unsigned
00993 //
00994 //  Arbitrary precision unsigned number.
00995 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00996 
00997 class SC_API sc_unsigned : public sc_value_base
00998 {
00999     friend class sc_concatref;
01000     friend class sc_unsigned_bitref_r;
01001     friend class sc_unsigned_bitref;
01002     friend class sc_unsigned_subref_r;
01003     friend class sc_unsigned_subref;
01004     friend class sc_signed;
01005     friend class sc_signed_subref;
01006     friend class sc_signed_subref_r;
01007 
01008     // Needed for types using sc_unsigned.
01009     typedef bool elemtype;
01010 
01011     void invalid_init( const char* type_name, int nb ) const;
01012 
01013 public:
01014 
01015     // constructors
01016 
01017     explicit sc_unsigned( int nb = sc_length_param().len() );
01018     sc_unsigned( const sc_unsigned& v );
01019     sc_unsigned( const sc_signed&   v );
01020     template<class T>
01021     explicit sc_unsigned( const sc_generic_base<T>& v );
01022     explicit sc_unsigned( const sc_bv_base& v );
01023     explicit sc_unsigned( const sc_lv_base& v );
01024     explicit sc_unsigned( const sc_int_subref_r& v );
01025     explicit sc_unsigned( const sc_uint_subref_r& v );
01026     explicit sc_unsigned( const sc_signed_subref_r& v );
01027     explicit sc_unsigned( const sc_unsigned_subref_r& v );
01028 
01029 
01030 
01031     // assignment operators
01032 
01033     const sc_unsigned& operator = (const sc_unsigned&        v);
01034     const sc_unsigned& operator = (const sc_unsigned_subref_r& a );
01035 
01036     template<class T>
01037     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
01038         { a->to_sc_unsigned(*this); return *this; }
01039 
01040     const sc_unsigned& operator = (const sc_signed&          v);
01041     const sc_unsigned& operator = (const sc_signed_subref_r& a );
01042 
01043     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( const char*               v);
01044     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( int64                     v);
01045     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( uint64                    v);
01046     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( long                      v);
01047     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( unsigned long             v);
01048 
01049     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( int                       v)
01050         { return operator=((long) v); }
01051 
01052     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( unsigned int              v)
01053         { return operator=((unsigned long) v); }
01054 
01055     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( double                    v);
01056     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( const sc_int_base&        v);
01057     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( const sc_uint_base&       v);
01058 
01059     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( const sc_bv_base& );
01060     const sc_unsigned& operator = ( const sc_lv_base& );
01061

01073         {
01074 #           ifndef SC_MAX_NBITS
01075                 delete [] digit;
01076 #           endif
01077         }

01080 
01081         sc_digit* get_raw() const { return digit; }

01083        { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return nbits-1; }
01084     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
01085     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;

01102 
01103     // bit selection
01104 
01105     inline void check_index( int i ) const
01106         { if ( (i < 0) || (i >= nbits-1) ) invalid_index(i); }
01107 
01108     void invalid_index( int i ) const;
01109 
01110     sc_unsigned_bitref& operator [] ( int i )
01111         {
01112             check_index(i);
01113             sc_unsigned_bitref* result_p =
01114                 sc_unsigned_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01115             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01116             return *result_p;
01117         }
01118 
01119     const sc_unsigned_bitref_r& operator [] ( int i ) const
01120         {
01121             check_index(i);
01122             sc_unsigned_bitref* result_p =
01123                 sc_unsigned_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01124             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01125             return *result_p;
01126         }
01127 
01128     sc_unsigned_bitref& bit( int i )
01129         {
01130             check_index(i);
01131             sc_unsigned_bitref* result_p =
01132                 sc_unsigned_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01133             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01134             return *result_p;
01135         }
01136 
01137     const sc_unsigned_bitref_r& bit( int i ) const
01138         {
01139             check_index(i);
01140             sc_unsigned_bitref* result_p =
01141                 sc_unsigned_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01142             result_p->initialize( this, i );
01143             return *result_p;
01144         }
01145 
01146 
01147     // part selection
01148 
01149     // Subref operators. Help access the range of bits from the ith to
01150     // jth. These indices have arbitrary precedence with respect to each
01151     // other, i.e., we can have i <= j or i > j. Note the equivalence
01152     // between range(i, j) and operator (i, j). Also note that
01153     // operator (i, i) returns an unsigned number that corresponds to the
01154     // bit operator [i], so these two forms are not the same.
01155 
01156     inline void check_range( int l, int r ) const
01157         {
01158             if ( l < r )
01159             {
01160                 if ( (l < 0) || (r >= nbits-1) ) invalid_range(l,r);
01161             }
01162             else
01163             {
01164                 if ( (r < 0) || (l >= nbits-1) ) invalid_range(l,r);
01165             }
01166         }
01167 
01168     void invalid_range( int l, int r ) const;
01169 
01170     sc_unsigned_subref& range( int i, int j )
01171         {
01172             check_range(i,j);
01173             sc_unsigned_subref* result_p =
01174                 sc_unsigned_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01175             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01176             return *result_p;
01177         }
01178 
01179     const sc_unsigned_subref_r& range( int i, int j ) const
01180         {
01181             check_range(i,j);
01182             sc_unsigned_subref* result_p =
01183                 sc_unsigned_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01184             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01185             return *result_p;
01186         }
01187 
01188     sc_unsigned_subref& operator () ( int i, int j )
01189         {
01190             check_range(i,j);
01191             sc_unsigned_subref* result_p =
01192                 sc_unsigned_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01193             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01194             return *result_p;
01195         }
01196 
01197     const sc_unsigned_subref_r& operator () ( int i, int j ) const
01198         {
01199             check_range(i,j);
01200             sc_unsigned_subref* result_p =
01201                 sc_unsigned_subref::m_pool.allocate();
01202             result_p->initialize( this, i, j );
01203             return *result_p;
01204         }
01205

01209     unsigned int  to_uint() const;
01210     long          to_long() const;
01211     unsigned long to_ulong() const;
01212     int64         to_int64() const;
01213     uint64        to_uint64() const;
01214     double        to_double() const;

01216 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
01217     int to_signed() const
01218         { return to_int(); }
01219 
01220     unsigned int to_unsigned() const
01221         { return to_uint(); }
01222 #endif

01239   // Functions to find various properties.
01240   int  length() const { return nbits - 1; }  // Bit width.
01241   bool iszero() const;                       // Is the number zero?
01242   bool sign() const { return 0; }            // Sign.
01243 
01244     // reduce methods
01245 
01246     bool and_reduce() const;
01247 
01248     bool nand_reduce() const
01249         { return ( ! and_reduce() ); }
01250 
01251     bool or_reduce() const;
01252 
01253     bool nor_reduce() const
01254         { return ( ! or_reduce() ); }
01255 
01256     bool xor_reduce() const;
01257 
01258     bool xnor_reduce() const
01259         { return ( ! xor_reduce() ); }
01260 
01261 
01262   // Functions to access individual bits.
01263   bool test(int i) const;      // Is the ith bit 0 or 1?
01264   void set(int i);             // Set the ith bit to 1.
01265   void clear(int i);           // Set the ith bit to 0.
01266   void set(int i, bool v)      // Set the ith bit to v.
01267     { if (v) set(i); else clear(i);  }
01268   void invert(int i)           // Negate the ith bit.
01269     { if (test(i)) clear(i); else set(i);  }
01270 
01271   // Make the number equal to its mirror image.
01272   void reverse();
01273 
01274   // Get/set a packed bit representation of the number.
01275   void get_packed_rep(sc_digit *buf) const;
01276   void set_packed_rep(sc_digit *buf);
01277 
01278   /*
01279     The comparison of the old and new semantics are as follows:
01280 
01281     Let s = sc_signed,
01282         u = sc_unsigned,
01283         un = { uint64, unsigned long, unsigned int },
01284         sn = { int64, long, int, char* }, and
01285         OP = { +, -, *, /, % }.
01286 
01287     Old semantics:                     New semantics:
01288       u OP u -> u                        u OP u -> u
01289       s OP u -> u                        s OP u -> s
01290       u OP s -> u                        u OP s -> s
01291       s OP s -> s                        s OP s -> s
01292 
01293       u OP un = un OP u -> u             u OP un = un OP u -> u
01294       u OP sn = sn OP u -> u             u OP sn = sn OP u -> s
01295 
01296       s OP un = un OP s -> s             s OP un = un OP s -> s
01297       s OP sn = sn OP s -> s             s OP sn = sn OP s -> s
01298 
01299     In the new semantics, the result is u if both operands are u; the
01300     result is s otherwise. The only exception is subtraction. The result
01301     of a subtraction is always s.
01302 
01303     The old semantics is like C/C++ semantics on integer types; the
01304     new semantics is due to the VSIA C/C++ data types standard.
01305    */
01306 
01307   // ARITHMETIC OPERATORS:
01308 
01309   // ADDition operators:
01310 
01311   friend   SC_API sc_signed operator + (const sc_unsigned&  u, const sc_signed&    v);

01957 public:

01959 
01960 private:
01961 
01962   small_type  sgn;         // Shortened as s.
01963   int nbits;       // Shortened as nb.
01964   int ndigits;     // Shortened as nd.
01965 
01966 #ifdef SC_MAX_NBITS
01967   sc_digit digit[DIV_CEIL(SC_MAX_NBITS)];   // Shortened as d.
01968 #else
01969   sc_digit *digit;                       // Shortened as d.
01970 #endif
01971 
01972   // Private constructors:
01973 
01974   // Create a copy of v with sign s.
01975   sc_unsigned(const sc_unsigned& v, small_type s);
01976   sc_unsigned(const sc_signed&   v, small_type s);
01977 
01978   // Create an unsigned number with the given attributes.
01979   sc_unsigned(small_type s, int nb, int nd,
01980               sc_digit *d, bool alloc = true);
01981 
01982   // Create an unsigned number using the bits u[l..r].
01983   sc_unsigned(const sc_signed* u, int l, int r);
01984   sc_unsigned(const sc_unsigned* u, int l, int r);
01985 
01986   // Private member functions. The called functions are inline functions.
01987 
01988   small_type default_sign() const
01989     { return SC_POS; }
01990 
01991   int num_bits(int nb) const { return nb + 1; }
01992 
01993   bool check_if_outside(int bit_num) const;
01994 
01995   void copy_digits(int nb, int nd, const sc_digit *d)
01996     { copy_digits_unsigned(sgn, nbits, ndigits, digit, nb, nd, d); }
01997 
01998   void makezero()
01999     { sgn = make_zero(ndigits, digit); }
02000 
02001   // Conversion functions between 2's complement (2C) and
02002   // sign-magnitude (SM):
02003   void convert_2C_to_SM()
02004     { sgn = convert_unsigned_2C_to_SM(nbits, ndigits, digit); }
02005 
02006   void convert_SM_to_2C_to_SM()
02007     { sgn = convert_unsigned_SM_to_2C_to_SM(sgn, nbits, ndigits, digit); }
02008 
02009   void convert_SM_to_2C()
02010     { convert_unsigned_SM_to_2C(sgn, ndigits, digit); }
02011 
02012 };

02049 template<class T>
02050 inline const sc_unsigned_subref& sc_unsigned_subref::operator = (
02051     const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
02052 {
02053     sc_unsigned temp( length() );
02054     a->to_sc_unsigned(temp);
02055     return *this = temp;
02056 }

02066 
02067 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02068 //  CLASS : sc_unsigned_subref_r
02069 //
02070 //  Proxy class for sc_unsigned part selection (r-value only).
02071 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02072 
02073 // reduce methods
02074 
02075 inline bool sc_unsigned_subref_r::and_reduce() const
02076 {
02077    const sc_unsigned* target_p = m_obj_p;
02078    for ( int i = m_right; i <= m_left; i++ )
02079         if ( !target_p->test(i) ) return false;
02080    return true;
02081 }
02082 
02083 inline bool sc_unsigned_subref_r::nand_reduce() const
02084 {
02085     return !and_reduce();
02086 }
02087 
02088 inline bool sc_unsigned_subref_r::or_reduce() const
02089 {
02090    const sc_unsigned* target_p = m_obj_p;
02091    for ( int i = m_right; i <= m_left; i++ )
02092         if ( target_p->test(i) ) return true;
02093    return false;
02094 }
02095 
02096 inline bool sc_unsigned_subref_r::nor_reduce() const
02097 {
02098     return !or_reduce();
02099 }
02100 
02101 inline bool sc_unsigned_subref_r::xor_reduce() const
02102 {
02103    int                odd;
02104    const sc_unsigned* target_p = m_obj_p;
02105    odd = 0;
02106    for ( int i = m_right; i <= m_left; i++ )
02107         if ( target_p->test(i) ) odd = ~odd;
02108    return odd ? true : false;
02109 }
02110 
02111 inline bool sc_unsigned_subref_r::xnor_reduce() const
02112 {
02113     return !xor_reduce();
02114 }
02115 
02116 
02117 inline
02118 ::std::ostream&
02119 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_unsigned_subref_r& a )
02120 {
02121     a.print( os );
02122     return os;
02123 }

02152 
02153 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02154 //  CLASS : sc_unsigned
02155 //
02156 //  Arbitrary precision signed number.
02157 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02158 
02159 template<class T>
02160 sc_unsigned::sc_unsigned( const sc_generic_base<T>& v )
02161 {
02162     int nb = v->length();
02163     sgn = default_sign();
02164     if( nb > 0 ) {
02165         nbits = num_bits( nb );
02166     } else {
02167         invalid_init( "sc_generic_base<T>", nb );
02168         sc_core::sc_abort(); // can't recover from here
02169     }
02170     ndigits = DIV_CEIL(nbits);
02171 #   ifdef SC_MAX_NBITS
02172         test_bound(nb);
02173 #    else
02174         digit = new sc_digit[ndigits];
02175 #    endif
02176     makezero();
02177     v->to_sc_unsigned(*this);
02178 }
02179 
02180 
02181 inline
02182 ::std::ostream&
02183 operator << ( ::std::ostream& os, const sc_unsigned& a )
02184 {
02185     a.print( os );
02186     return os;
02187 }
02188 
02189 inline
02190 ::std::istream&
02191 operator >> ( ::std::istream& is, sc_unsigned& a )
02192 {
02193     a.scan( is );
02194     return is;
02195 }
